title: Firefox custom url homepage shows the custom url
content: So I am using bento as my homepage, and it is a homepage replacement thing. Anyway I want to use the custom url setting with it not showing the url, and still loading the site, if you can help that would be great. Thank you.
creator: o2

title: How to install 2nd FF to different program folder so it has a unique profile?
content:
I have a working FF installation with a group of tabs. I have a Pale Moon installation with its own group of tabs, I would like to stop using PM and install a 2nd FF installation to a unique program folder so it has its own unique profile, so I can import the bookmarks, tabs etc, from PM, which will let me have 2 FF browsers open at the same time, loaded with two different sets of tabs.

I read that if I install a 2nd FF to a unique *program folder by **entering that during the install, setting this up would be straightforward. So I downloaded a FF installer, ran it, and it installed FF without asking me where I wanted to install it!

Can I force the FF installer to give me the option of selecting a custom program folder?

  • Dedicated profiles per Firefox installation 
  https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/dedicated-profiles-firefox-installation#firefox:win10:fx107
    • Custom installation of Firefox on Windows 
   https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/custom-installation-firefox-on-windows

Thank you, Mike
creator: mscir

title: Weird non-working issue
content: Hello, I recently installed and uninstalled HitFilm. After doing that, Firefox is non-functional. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling (which required using Revo Uninstaller, because the program read as running even though it wasn't). Now when I install Firefox, it says that VRUNTIME140_1DLL was not found, even though the file is clearly in the Programs folder. Firefox installs, but won't navigate to any web pages. Chrome and Microsoft Edge work fine. I asked someone at the computer store and they were completely flummoxed. Please help!
creator: creed.cr21

title: No sound on firefox
content:
Hello, I swapped computer cases and for some reason after I did that I do not have sound in firefox. I tried resetting it, uninstalling it, removing all files from the app data folders, I confirmed I have the windows media optional feature package. I am at a loss and I don't know what to try next. Please help.

PS I have only recently learned of the glory of firefox and I don't want to have to switch back to our chrome overlords.
creator: linzellwilliams

title: Backup/Exported Bookmarks files (.json/.html) aren't the same (checksum) between Synced devices
content:
Hi, thanks a lot in advance and sorry to bother. :)

I have a couple of desktop/laptop devices synced with the same account. When I make a backup/export of my bookmarks in each device (.json/.html files) the checksums of those files don't coincide between devices. Nevertheless, if I open the exported HTMLs in Firefox and save them as Text Files, the resultant files have all the same checksum (sha256sum), i.e., are all the same.

Is this how it is supposed to be? Or should my bookmarks JSON/HTML files be exactly the same in all devices and something is wrong?

Thanks a lot in advance.
creator: rv.sin.mail

title: How to DISABLE the back and forward arrows that now come up on the left and right sides of the Firefox panel
content: HELP!!! Tell me how to DISABLE the back and forward arrows that now come up on the left and right sides of the Firefox panel from out of nowhere. They keep destroying my work even though I try my hardest to avoid them! They have my swearing at my computer.
creator: jedi2

title: Firefox Lags When Typing
content: When typing, Firefox will lag and not display the words until much later, making it hard to know what I'm typing. This applies to any app that I'm using on the browser. For example, I typed this whole paragraph before a single word appeared, and even then, it still took another 30 seconds to actually appear. I've already reset, refreshed, uninstalled and reinstalled, updated, everything like that. I have a couple extensions, AdBlock, Honey, WebRTC Lead Shield, and Return YouTube dislike. But I ran it in safe mode and the issue was still there. I'm running the latest version of Windows 11 if that makes any difference.
creator: kysonty

Maybe I have to swap my default browser to Microsoft Edge??? Brian Coddington
creator: codsy01

title: YouTube won't play in Firefox browser
content:
I haven't made any changes to my browser settings, but within the last two weeks, Firefox has ceased playing YouTube videos. When I start a video, all I see is a spinning processor wheel, and then the advice to restart my device. No matter how long I wait, the video never plays. I actually have to go into Microsoft Blue, or Wave, whatever it's calling itself, to view a video. All other functionality on the site is fine: saving a video in a playlist, getting the script to copy the link, liking, etc.

I haven't changed anything in my browser settings in months. I had things the way I like them. I don't know what's changed.
creator: AborigenGTS

title: Bookmarks in Bookmarks Toolbar have disappeared as well as all bookmarks
content: All my bookmarks have disappeared from bookmarks. I restored bookmarks in the menu folder but my bookmarks in the bookmarks toolbar are still missing. How can I get my bookmarks in my bookmarks toolbar back?

title: Firefox Google Maps goes black after switching to multi-monitor
content:
The problem that Google Maps goes black after a few seconds was reported here a couple of times.

I have a variation of the problem in that it appears only when I connect my laptop (Lenovo P15 with Nvidia Quadro RTX 3000) to an external monitor. After connecting, the only way to get Google Maps to work again is to close Firefox and restart it. Closing and reopening the tab or force-reloading is not sufficient.
creator: wimmer1

title: Filter my history by device?
content:
Is it possible to filter my history by device so I can see only what sites I’ve visited on my computer vs.my other devices?

I had a private window open when I closed Firefox to update, and when I re-opened Firefox all of my previously open tabs had disappeared! (Private tab gone of course, but all of the tabs in my usual window were gone and no way to "re-open" that session.
creator: harris.rogers
